[112]:

import scipy as sp
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as mpatches

[113]:

from random import seed


dist = sp.stats.multivariate_normal([0, 0], [[2.0, 0.8], [0.8, 0.5]], seed = 1)
X = dist.rvs(30)
x = X[:,0]
y = X[:, 1]

[114]:

mean_est = X.mean(0)
cov_est = np.cov(X.T)
dist_est = sp.stats.multivariate_normal(mean_est, cov_est)

[115]:

rect = mpatches.Rectangle((x.min(), y.min()),
                            x.max() - x.min(),
                            y.max() - y.min(),
                            facecolor = 'darkblue',
                            alpha = 0.2)

margin = 0.5

xx, yy = np.mgrid[-4:4:.005, -4:4:.005]
pos = np.dstack((xx, yy))

fig = plt.figure(dpi = 300, figsize = (10,6))
ax1 = fig.add_subplot(121)
ax1.set_title('Uniform Distribution Density')
ax1.add_patch(rect)
ax1.scatter(x,y, s = 1.2, color = 'black')
ax1.set_xlim(x.min()-margin,x.max()+margin)
ax1.set_ylim(y.min()-margin,y.max()+margin)
ax1.set_xticks([],[])
ax1.set_yticks([],[])


ax2 = fig.add_subplot(122)
ax2.set_title("Multivariate Gaussian Distribution Density")
ax2.contourf(xx, yy, dist_est.pdf(pos), cmap = 'Blues')
ax2.scatter(x,y, s = 1.2, color = 'black')
ax2.set_xlim(x.min()-margin,x.max()+margin)
ax2.set_ylim(y.min()-margin,y.max()+margin)
ax2.set_xticks([],[])
ax2.set_yticks([],[])
plt.savefig('../img/normal_vs_uniform.png')
